articles.title: After Lionel Messi’s Bold Advice for Kylian Mbappe to Quit France, President Emmanuel Macron Shades Argentina Legend in a 4-Word Message
articles.description: After leaving PSG for Inter Miami, Lionel Messi advised Kylian Mbappe to leave the club as French President chose between Leo and CR7.
articles.content: The sensational Lionel Messi left PSG for Inter Miami as he uncovers a new chapter of his life. He had a rather underwhelming spell at the French club despite early promise. The soccer star was unable to secure the coveted UEFA Champions League for t... [3142 chars]

articles.title: Rights to the works of Argentine literary giant Jorge Luis Borges granted to his widow's nephews
articles.description: A court has granted the rights to the works of the late Jorge Luis Borges, considered Argentina’s most internationally significant author of the 20th century, to five nephews of the author’s widow who died in March.
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — A court has granted the rights to the works of the late Jorge Luis Borges, considered Argentina’s most internationally significant author of the 20th century, to five nephews of the author’s widow who died in March.

articles.title: Argentina's junta used a plane to hurl dissident mothers and nuns to their deaths from the sky. Decades later, it returned home from Florida.
articles.description: A cargo plane used by military henchmen during Argentina's "dirty war" to fly political opponents over the ocean and push them to their deaths has been brought back to the country.
articles.content: Flying from Florida to Buenos Aires usually takes about 10 hours, but the turboprop landing in Argentina on Saturday was no normal plane. It had been en route for 20 days, and many Argentines eagerly refreshed flight tracking software to keep tabs on... [7192 chars]

articles.title: Argentina 'death flight' plane returned from US
articles.description: Argentine officials on Monday welcomed the return of an airplane from which the country's last military dictatorship threw political opponents to their deaths, and that will now be part of a museum dedicated to the victims' memory.
articles.content: [1/4] A plane used in the last Argentine military dictatorship (1976-1983) by the Naval Prefecture under registration PA-51, used in 1977 to throw alive into the sea three members of the organisation Mothers of Plaza de Mayo, a group of women united ... [2318 chars]

articles.title: Argentina 'death flight' plane returned from US
articles.description: "It is terrible to think that a mother who was only looking for her son was thrown alive from this plane," her daughter Cecila told Reuters. At the request of relatives of the victims, Argentina's economy minister bought the plane and organized its transfer from the United States.
articles.content:
Argentine officials on Monday welcomed the return of an airplane from which the country's last military dictatorship threw political opponents to their deaths, and that will now be part of a museum dedicated to the victims' memory.

articles.title: Argentina's election line-up twist boosts markets, adds spice to IMF talks
articles.description: Argentina's election line-up twist, which saw the ruling Peronist coalition torpedo a leftist candidate in favor of a centrist economy minister, boosted local markets on Monday, though analysts said it added a new spice to talks with the IMF.

articles.title: 'I didn’t like the attention' - Salt Bae breaks silence about World Cup pitch invasion that left Alexis Mac Allister and Argentina bemused
articles.description: The internet sensation faced backlash after invading Argentina's immediate World Cup Final celebrations, but now has come out defending his antics
articles.content:
Salt Bae has finally discussed his antics during Argentina's post-match celebrations at the 2022 World Cup Final that saw him cause mass outrage among football fans.
